description.narrative: MCC's $437 million Niger Sustainable Water and Agriculture Compact will support improvements to three major constraints to economic growth and investment in Niger: lack of reliable access to water for agricultural use and livestock; lack of access to markets; and a fragmented and inefficient business regulatory system. In partnership with the Government of Niger, the MCC compact will strengthen Niger's agricultural sector by improving water availability, infrastructure, and market access, and has the potential to benefit more than 3.9 million people.

title.narrative: Niger Compact Monitoring and Evaluation Plan

condition.narrative: All Government entities involved in the implementation of the Program, including the Implementing Entities, are coordinating successfully with MCA-Niger, and dedicating the necessary staff and other resources to ensure successful implementation of the Program
All applicable conditions precedent in Annex II have been duly satisfied, deferred, or waived as provided in this Agreement

Any Taxes paid with MCC Funding through the date ninety (90) days prior to the start of the applicable Disbursement Period have been reimbursed by the Government in full in accordance with Section 2.8(c) of the Compact
Copies of reports from any technical auditors engaged by MCA-Niger
Each of the Key Staff remains engaged, or if a position is vacant, MCA-Niger is actively engaged, to MCC's satisfaction, in recruiting a replacement

MCA-Niger has complied in all material respects with its obligations set forth in Section 2.1(d) with respect to establishment of a BCS and its obligations set forth in Section 2.3 with respect to the establishment of an M&E Plan
MCA-Niger has delivered to MCC the following documents, reports, and information in form and substance satisfactory to MCC: A completed Disbursement Request
MCA-Niger has delivered to MCC the following documents, reports, and information in form and substance satisfactory to MCC: A completed Disbursement Request, including: Detailed Financial Plan
MCA-Niger has delivered to MCC the following documents, reports, and information in form and substance satisfactory to MCC: A completed Disbursement Request, including: Fiscal Agent Certificate
MCA-Niger has delivered to MCC the following documents, reports, and information in form and substance satisfactory to MCC: A completed Disbursement Request, including: MCA-Niger Certificate
MCA-Niger has delivered to MCC the following documents, reports, and information in form and substance satisfactory to MCC: A completed Disbursement Request, including: Narrative Report
MCA-Niger has delivered to MCC the following documents, reports, and information in form and substance satisfactory to MCC: A completed Disbursement Request, including: Procurement Agent Certificate
MCA-Niger has delivered to MCC the following documents, reports, and information in form and substance satisfactory to MCC: A completed Disbursement Request, including: Quarterly Financial Report
MCA-Niger has delivered to MCC the following documents, reports, and information in form and substance satisfactory to MCC: A completed Disbursement Request, including: Conditions Precedent Report
MCA-Niger has delivered to MCC the following documents, reports, and information in form and substance satisfactory to MCC: A completed Disbursement Request, including: Indicator Tracking Table
MCA-Niger has delivered to MCC the following documents, reports, and information in form and substance satisfactory to MCC: A completed Disbursement Request, including: Procurement Performance Report
MCA-Niger has developed a complete Implementation Plan.

MCA-Niger must have submitted to MCC evidence that MCA-Niger or the appropriate Government entity has developed and adopted an environmental and social impact assessment, an environmental and social management plan, health and safety management plan, a resettlement action plan, or livelihood restoration plan,, and a TIP risk assessment with respect to such Activity

MCA-Niger will have developed and adapted an environmental and social management system ("ESMS") (including a stakeholder engagement plan) in accordance with the MCC Environmental Guidelines as evidenced by (a) a resolution of the MCA Board; and (b) staffing plan, training plan, and budget for the ESMS
MCA-Niger will have developed and approved a comprehensive Social and Gender Integration Plan

MCC does not have grounds for concluding that any matter certified to it in the related MCA Disbursement Certificate, Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate, or Fiscal Agent Certificate is not as certified

No act, omission, condition, or event has occurred that would be the basis for MCC to suspend or terminate, in whole or in part, the Compact or MCC Funding in accordance with Section 5.1 of the Compact

No material default or breach of any covenant, obligation or responsibility by the Government, MCA-Niger or any Government entity has occurred and is continuing under the Compact, this Agreement, or any Supplemental Agreement, or under any systems, rules, policies, plans, or guidance issued by MCA-Niger.

The Government has obtained MCC?s written consent to any modification or any systems, rules, policies, plans, or guidance issued by the Government or MCA-Niger, as the case may be, in fulfillment of any obligation set forth in the Compact or this Program Implementation Agreement?

The Government has satisfied all of its payment obligations, including any insurance, indemnification, tax payments or other obligations, and contributed all resources required from it, under the Compact, this Agreement, and any Supplemental Agreement
The Government must have submitted to MCC an initial draft Compact Closure Plan in accordance with the MCC Program Closure Guidelines

The Government, or MCA-Niger as applicable, has made sufficient progress in implementing any systems, rules, plans, policies, or guidance issued by the Government or MCA-Niger, as the case may be, in fulfillment of any obligation set forth in the Compact, or this Program Implementation Agreement

The Implementation Plan Documents and the Fiscal Accountability Plan are current and updated and are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, and there has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the components of the Implementation Plan for any relevant Projects or Activities related to such Disbursement
The activities to be funded with such Disbursement will not violate any applicable law or regulation

There has been no material negative finding in any financial audit report delivered in accordance with the Compact and the Audit Plan, for the prior two quarters, (or such other period as the Audit Plan may require)

There has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the M&E Plan, ESMS, and Social and Gender Integration Plan for the Program, relevant Project or Activity, and substantial compliance with the requirements of the M&E Plan, ESMS, and Social and Gender Integration Plan (including targets set forth therein?)
